intro: Marginaria formosana, commonly known as the Formosan marginaria, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are slender and often trailing. Marginaria formosana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
